column2:
When mankind was first learning the basics of stone tools, my kind found this world through the veil that separates worlds. We established homes here, in this wild land. We watched, guided, and occasionally warred with the evolving humans. 
  For reasons unknown - the veil faded and those who were here had no method to return. Over the course of a few millenniums, my kind died off. Be it from age, aggression, or disease. 
  I am now one of only a few who remain. 
  And while I realize that although I'm an elf, our blood line invariably mixed with humans, and as such, I'm truly somewhere in between both worlds. 
  Human sages refer to our dying off as the Fading Twilight. While my remaining brethren may accept this, I do not. I've worked my way through the human world and now rule over my own lands.
We shall not pass into the night on my watch.
